intro: Baissea axillaris, commonly known as the rock fig, is a small shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, edible fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in inflorescences. The rock fig is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
